title: Pudding or ooze
data:
The **pudding or ooze** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the uppercase [P](/wiki/P "P") glyph (P). Puddings and oozes are designated internally by the macro **S\_PUDDING**.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- P [gray ooze](/wiki/Gray_ooze "Gray ooze")
- P [brown pudding](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding")
- P [green slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime")
- P [black pudding](/wiki/Black_pudding "Black pudding")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 History](#History)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Variants](#Variants)
  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [6 References](#References)

## Common traits

Puddings and oozes are [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral"), [amorphous](/wiki/Amorphous "Amorphous") and [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivorous "Omnivorous") [amoeboids](/wiki/Amoeboid "Amoeboid") - as amoeboid monsters, they are [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing") and lack limbs, [eyes](/wiki/Eyeless "Eyeless") or [a head](/wiki/Headless "Headless"). Each pudding or ooze is generally slower-moving than an unhasted and unburdened character, and their bodies are [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic"), granting them [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"); they also have [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") as well.

Most of the puddings and oozes use bite attacks and are capable of inducing [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion") in certain materials, either actively with their bites or passively via contact with their bodies. The green slime is the exception in both cases: it uses a touch attack and does not affect the materials of weapons or worn armor in favor of [turning a character themselves into slime](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming").

### Generation

Randomly generated puddings and oozes are always created hostile.

Puddings and oozes leave behind [globs](/wiki/Glob "Glob") instead of [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") as a death drop - globs are [fleshy](/wiki/Fleshy "Fleshy") and acidic [comestibles](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that cannot be [revived](/wiki/Revive "Revive") or [sacrificed](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice"), take much longer to decay (though they still become [tainted](/wiki/Tainted "Tainted") and cause [food poisoning](/wiki/Food_poisoning "Food poisoning") as normal), and can merge with other globs of the same material.

## History

The pudding and ooze monster class first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), which introduces the gray ooze and both puddings. The green slime is introduced in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

The pudding and ooze globs first appear in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Ooze (Dungeons & Dragons)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ooze_\(Dungeons_%26_Dragons\) "wikipedia:Ooze (Dungeons & Dragons)")***

The pudding or ooze monster class corresponds to the "ooze" creature type in Dungeons & Dragons, with similar abilities to erode and eat through certain types of material.

## Variants

In variants based on [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and previous versions, puddings and oozes may still drop corpses.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces three new monsters to the monster class:

- P [moldy pudding](/wiki/Moldy_pudding "Moldy pudding")
- P [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shoggoth (SLASH'EM)")
- P [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth")

SLASH'EM is based on versions of NetHack prior to 3.6.0, meaning that puddings and other monsters in the class still leave behind corpses.

## Encyclopedia entry

These giant amoeboid creatures look like nothing more than puddles of slime, but they both live and move, feeding on metal or wood as well as the occasional dungeon explorer to supplement their diet.  
  
But we were not on a station platform. We were on the track ahead as the nightmare, plastic column of fetid black iridescence oozed tightly onward through its fifteen-foot sinus, gathering unholy speed and driving before it a spiral, re-thickening cloud of the pallid abyss vapor. It was a terrible, indescribable thing vaster than any subway train -- a shapeless congeries of protoplasmic bubbles, faintly self-luminous, and with myriads of temporary eyes forming and unforming as pustules of greenish light all over the tunnel-filling front that bore down upon us, crushing the frantic penguins and slithering over the glistening floor that it and its kind had swept so evilly free of all litter.

\[ At the Mountains of Madness, by H.P. Lovecraft ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 56](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L56)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1683](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L1683)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Pudding or ooze

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The pudding or ooze is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the uppercase P glyph (P). Puddings and oozes are designated internally by the macro S_PUDDING.[1]

The class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • P gray ooze
  • P brown pudding
  • P green slime
  • P black pudding

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Common traits

Puddings and oozes are neutral, amorphous and omnivorous amoeboids - as amoeboid monsters, they are unbreathing and lack limbs, eyes or a head. Each pudding or ooze is generally slower-moving than an unhasted and unburdened character, and their bodies are acidic, granting them acid resistance and stoning resistance; they also have cold resistance and poison resistance as well.

Most of the puddings and oozes use bite attacks and are capable of inducing erosion in certain materials, either actively with their bites or passively via contact with their bodies. The green slime is the exception in both cases: it uses a touch attack and does not affect the materials of weapons or worn armor in favor of turning a character themselves into slime.

Generation

Randomly generated puddings and oozes are always created hostile.

Puddings and oozes leave behind globs instead of corpses as a death drop - globs are fleshy and acidic comestibles that cannot be revived or sacrificed, take much longer to decay (though they still become tainted and cause food poisoning as normal), and can merge with other globs of the same material.

History

The pudding and ooze monster class first appears in NetHack 3.0.0, which introduces the gray ooze and both puddings. The green slime is introduced in NetHack 3.3.0.

The pudding and ooze globs first appear in NetHack 3.6.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Ooze (Dungeons & Dragons)

The pudding or ooze monster class corresponds to the "ooze" creature type in Dungeons & Dragons, with similar abilities to erode and eat through certain types of material.

Variants

In variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 and previous versions, puddings and oozes may still drop corpses.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces three new monsters to the monster class:

  • P moldy pudding
  • P shoggoth
  • P giant shoggoth

SLASH'EM is based on versions of NetHack prior to 3.6.0, meaning that puddings and other monsters in the class still leave behind corpses.

Encyclopedia entry

These giant amoeboid creatures look like nothing more than puddles of slime, but they both live and move, feeding on metal or wood as well as the occasional dungeon explorer to supplement their diet.

But we were not on a station platform. We were on the track ahead as the nightmare, plastic column of fetid black iridescence oozed tightly onward through its fifteen-foot sinus, gathering unholy speed and driving before it a spiral, re-thickening cloud of the pallid abyss vapor. It was a terrible, indescribable thing vaster than any subway train -- a shapeless congeries of protoplasmic bubbles, faintly self-luminous, and with myriads of temporary eyes forming and unforming as pustules of greenish light all over the tunnel-filling front that bore down upon us, crushing the frantic penguins and slithering over the glistening floor that it and its kind had swept so evilly free of all litter.

[ At the Mountains of Madness, by H.P. Lovecraft ]

References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 56
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1683
